intro: Melandrium bellidioides, commonly known as the yellow sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, yellow, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
